Special Topics in Communication Networks and Autonomous Security (MINF-KS-CNAS)

Important: The first meeting (see above) will be used for topic presentations and general discussion of organizational aspects. Participation in this meeting is MANDATORY for taking part in the seminar. Also, you need to fill out the

This seminar will cover a wide range of security-related topics, focusing on research approaches and application domains that require a certain degree of autonomy. We will also look at current trends in security threats and regulatory discussions.
The seminar topics will likely be presented in Late July and early September. Concrete dates will be announced in early May. Seminar reports must be submitted by the end of September.
Is it possible to use ChatGPT & Co. in theses? And if so, how do you cite it?
Official answers from TU Berlin to these questions.
Background literature for conducting the survey and creating scientific reports
B. Kitchenham, “Procedures for Performing Systematic Reviews,” Keele University, TR/SE-0401, Jul. 2004.
TU Berlin guidelines for scientific work
Collection of links for students that need to write scientific reports:
Bill Buchanan. As a PhD Examiner … My Top 25 Tips for PhD students. 2018.
Where to find good sources for your report
First, be aware of predatory journals, and DO NOT use an article published in such journals.
Below is an overview of good source locations.
ACM Transactions on Privacy and Security
IEEE Transactions on Dependable and Secure Computing
IEEE Transactions on Information Forensics and Security
ACM Symposium on Access Control Models and Technologies (SACMAT)
ACM Symposium on Information, Computer and Communications Security (ASIA CCS)
IEEE Conference on Communications and Network Security (CNS)
IEEE Symposium on Security and Privacy (S&P)
European Symposium on Research in Computer Security (ESORICS)
International Symposium on Research in Attacks, Intrusions, and Defences (RAID)
SIG SIDAR Conference on Detection of Intrusions and Malware & Vulnerability Assessment (DIMVA)
Aktivität Seminar organization and topic presentation auswählen
Select your topic for the seminar. In case you choose to not participate in the seminar after you selected a topic, please either inform Karsten or unselect your topic.
Aktivität Seminar Autonomous Security - Organization auswählen
Aktivität Writing a Seminar Report auswählen
Aktivität Abstract and Research Question auswählen

For this task, you should clarify the aim of your report. The seminar topics are typically broad and require some refinement/focus.  The draft for the abstract should clarify what you want to research and focus on.
Aktivität Outline, Introduction and State of the Art auswählen
Outline, Introduction and State of the Art

For this task, you can submit a refined abstract, and you must submit an outline for the report (this should not be more than just section headings but also main content bullet points). The state-of-the-art section also must contain an initial selection of papers you want to include.
Before the presentations, we require you to submit a complete draft document of your report. This report may be refined for the final based on our comments and feedback during the presentation.

The slides for the presentation should be uploaded to ISIS either on the day of the presentation or before that. Please also send a draft version a week before your presentation date to your supervisor. So that we have time to review and give feedback and you have the time to address the feedback.
